text:
Welcome to the Staircase

Dimly lit staircase; Raskolnikov looks uneasy.  
Svidrigaïlov grins mischievously.  
Svidrigaïlov: “You’d better shoot yourself, or don’t you want to?”  

Raskolnikov: “You’re trying to enrage me.”  
Svidrigaïlov: “What a queer fellow! Here we are.”  

---
Outside a locked flat; Svidrigaïlov is eager.  
Svidrigaïlov: “Madame Resslich is busy, an excellent woman!”  

Svidrigaïlov: “Shall we take a cab? I’m going to the Islands.”  
Raskolnikov (thinking): “Suspicion feels unjust, but…”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling disgusted, distances himself from Svidrigaïlov, suspecting his intentions regarding his sister.
